sen.j: マキノ智子（まきの ともこ、1907年1月29日 - 1984年10月20日）は、日本の俳優である。
sen.e: Tomoko MAKINO (January 29, 1907 - October 20, 1984) was the Japanese actress.
Tomoko MAKINO (January 29, 1907 - October 20, 1984) was the Japanese actress.
Tomoko MAKINO (January 29, 1907 - October 20, 1984) was the Japanese actress.

sen.j: 「日本映画の父」として知られる牧野省三の四女であり、父の映画の子役からスタートし、スター女優となった。
sen.e: She was the fourth daughter of Shozo MAKINO known as 'The father of Japanese films,' and she started her career as a child actress in her father's film and became a star actress.
sen.cmt: 日本映画の父→The father of Japanese films [http://www.eidanren.com/activity02_english.html]
sen.e: She was the fourth daughter of Shozo MAKINO known as 'The father of Japanese films,' and she started her career as a child actress in her father's film and became a star actress.
She was the fourth daughter of Shozo MAKINO known as 'The father of Japanese films,' and she started her career as a child actress in her father's film and became a star actress.

sen.j: 本名加藤 恵美子（かとう えみこ、旧姓牧野）。
sen.e: Her real name was Emiko KATO (maiden name: Makino).
Her real name was Emiko KATO (maiden name was Makino).
Her real name was Emiko KATO (maiden name was Makino).

sen.j: 前芸名は、マキノ輝子、牧野智子、藤野智子、牧野輝子、マキノ恵美子、マキノ笑子。
sen.e: Her former stage names were Teruko MAKINO (マキノ輝子), Tomoko MAKINO (牧野智子), Tomoko FUJINO (藤野智子), Teruko MAKINO (牧野輝子), Emiko MAKINO (マキノ恵美子) and Emiko MAKINO (マキノ笑子).
sen.cmt: カタカナ、漢字の区別をつけるため、（）内に和名を入れました。
sen.e: Her former stage names were Teruko MAKINO (マキノ輝子), Tomoko MAKINO (牧野智子), Tomoko FUJINO (藤野智子), Teruko MAKINO (牧野輝子), Emiko MAKINO (マキノ恵美子) and Emiko MAKINO (マキノ笑子).
Her former stage names were Teruko MAKINO (マキノ輝子), Tomoko MAKINO (牧野智子), Tomoko FUJINO (藤野智子), Teruko MAKINO (牧野輝子), Emiko MAKINO (マキノ恵美子) and Emiko MAKINO (マキノ笑子).

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）1月29日、京都市に生まれる。
sen.e: She was born in Kyoto City on January 29, 1907.
She was born in Kyoto City on January 29, 1907.
She was born in Kyoto City on January 29, 1907.

sen.j: 1歳下の弟に映画監督のマキノ雅弘がいる。
sen.e: She had a brother one year younger than she, Masahiro MAKINO, who was a film director.
She had a brother one year younger than she, Masahiro MAKINO, who was a film director.
sen.cmt: 余分な改行を削除しました。
sen.e: She had a brother one year younger than she, Masahiro MAKINO, who was a film director.

sen.j: 「マキノ輝子」時代に、妻子ある月形龍之介とダブル主演的な共演を続けた後に、不倫・駆け落ちをし、一女を儲けている。
sen.e: After she starred in with Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA, who had a wife and child, when she was 'Teruko Makino (マキノ輝子)', she committed adultery and ran off with him and had a daughter.
After she starred in with Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA, who had a wife and child, when she was 'Teruko Makino' (マキノ輝子), she committed adultery and ran off with him and had a daughter.
After she starred in with Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA, who had a wife and child, when she was 'Teruko Makino' (マキノ輝子), she committed adultery and ran off with him and had a daughter.

sen.j: 後にスター俳優沢村国太郎と結婚、後の俳優長門裕之、津川雅彦（マキノ雅彦）兄弟を産む。
sen.e: Later, she married an star actor, Kunitaro SAWAMURA and gave birth to two sons, who later became actors named Hiroyuki NAGATO and Masahiko TSUGAWA (Masahiko MAKINO).
Later, she married a star actor, Kunitaro SAWAMURA and gave birth to two sons, who later became actors named Hiroyuki NAGATO and Masahiko TSUGAWA (also known as Masahiko MAKINO).
Later, she married a star actor, Kunitaro SAWAMURA and gave birth to two sons, who later became actors named Hiroyuki NAGATO and Masahiko TSUGAWA (also known as Masahiko MAKINO).

sen.j: 戦後も俳優を続けたがやがて引退。
sen.e: She pursued her acting career even after the war, but she retired before long.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処文
sen.e: She pursued her acting career even after the war, but she retired before long.
She pursued her acting career even after the war, but she retired before long.
She died at age 77 on October 20, 1984.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処文
sen.e: She died at the age of 77 on October 20, 1984.
She died at the age of 77 on October 20, 1984.

sen.j: 女優の沢村貞子、俳優の加東大介は義妹弟である。
sen.e: The actress, Sadako SAWAMURA, and the actor, Daisuke KATO, were her sister-in-law and brother-in-law, respectively.
The actress, Sadako SAWAMURA, and the actor, Daisuke KATO, were her younger sister-in-law and brother-in-law, respectively.
The actress, Sadako SAWAMURA, and the actor, Daisuke KATO, were her younger sister-in-law and brother-in-law, respectively.
